Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • Controller

  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to manipulate the controller based on the actions from the view
    Author:
    Bergen Kjeseth

    • Field Summary

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void computerReceiveTurn()
      First has the computer wait to receive the first turn, then calls computerTurn() to begin the AI's game loop
      void computerTurn()
      While the game hasn't ended, chooses a random column for the computer to play and calls update with that column, then sends the move and waits for the next one if a connection has been established
      void humanReceiveTurn()
      Used for the first turn of the client, receives a move without making one first.
      void humanTurn(int col)
      This method calls the update method in the model with what column was chosen by the player, then sends the move and waits to receive the next one if a connection has been established.
      boolean isGameOver()
      This method calls the model method isGameOver to determine if someone has won.
      boolean isWinner() 
      private void sendAndReceive(Connect4MoveMessage move)
      Sends @param move to the other player, then waits for the next move if the game hasn't ended
      void startClient(java.lang.String address, int port)
      Starts a client instance Connects to the server at @param address and @param port, then set the input and output streams to the server's, and sets the client to receive the first move
      void startServer(int port)
      Starts a server instance Waits for a connection from a client, then sets the input and output streams to the client's

    • Method Detail

      • humanTurn

        public void humanTurn(int col)
        This method calls the update method in the model with what column was chosen by the player, then sends the move and waits to receive the next one if a connection has been established.
        Parameters:
        col - the column chosen by the player

      • humanReceiveTurn

        public void humanReceiveTurn()
        Used for the first turn of the client, receives a move without making one first.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - or IOException if there is an error reading the next move

      • computerTurn

        public void computerTurn()
        While the game hasn't ended, chooses a random column for the computer to play and calls update with that column, then sends the move and waits for the next one if a connection has been established

      • computerReceiveTurn

        public void computerReceiveTurn()
        First has the computer wait to receive the first turn, then calls computerTurn() to begin the AI's game loop
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - or IOException if there is an error reading the next move

      • sendAndReceive

        private void sendAndReceive(Connect4MoveMessage move)
        Sends @param move to the other player, then waits for the next move if the game hasn't ended
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - or IOException if there is an error writing this move or reading the next move

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        This method calls the model method isGameOver to determine if someone has won.
        Returns:
        whether the game is over or not

      • isWinner

        public boolean isWinner()
        Returns:
        whether or not this instance of the game was the winner

      • startServer

        public void startServer(int port)
        Starts a server instance Waits for a connection from a client, then sets the input and output streams to the client's
        Parameters:
        port - the port to be opened for the server
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there's a problem opening the server or getting the connection

      • startClient

        public void startClient(java.lang.String address,
                        int port)
        Starts a client instance Connects to the server at @param address and @param port, then set the input and output streams to the server's, and sets the client to receive the first move
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if there's a problem connecting to the specified address and port
        java.io.IOException - if there's a problem getting the socket or IO streams from the server
